name: Native Sulphur on Aragonite
description: Ex Luis Burillo specimen. Bright sulphur crystals to 15mm cover the aragonite surface of this specimen from an iconic location.

name: Stibnite
origin: Wuling Mine, Qingjiang, Jiangxi Province, China
description: A spray of metallic stibnite, with crystals to 80mm long. Some crystals show growth distortion. Mounted on an acrylic base to display well.

name: Green Fluorite
origin: Riemvasmaak, northern Cape Province, South Africa
description: Bright green octohedrons of fluorite from a classic African location.

name: Cavanasite and Stilbite
description: A nice free standing specimen with the blue and cream of the minerals making for a pleasant contrast

name: Vesuvianite
origin: Fushan Mine, She Co., Handan Prefecture, Hubei Province, China
description: A large (for the species) glossy crystal with clean bevelled edges

name: Wulfenite
origin: La Morita Mine, Sierra Mojina District, Chihuahua, Mexico
description: A small but perfect miniature with bright bevelled plates of wulfenite.Largest crystal 15mm.

name: Azurite and Malachite
origin: Sepon Mine, Vilabouly District, Savannakhét Province, Laos
description: Velvet green malachites contrast with vughs of ink blue sharp azurite crystals in a showy cabinet specimen. The specimen has a sawn back but displays well.

name: Alpine Quartz and Chlorite
origin: Pointe Isabel Talefre Glacier, Mont Blanc, Chamonix, France
description: Large trasparent crystal of quartz with a light dusting of green chlorite. Has a prominent extra "window" facet face.
